title: Computational Thinking Development in Elementary Education: Constructivist-Based Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational theory knowledge and general familiarity with primary education environments
context.additional_context: A pre-service teacher training course emphasizing methodologies for integrating computational thinking into non-CS subject areas

learning_goals: Cultivate the competency to design computational thinking (CT) activities based on constructivist learning theory
Develop lesson plans applying CT core elements (decomposition, pattern recognition, abstraction, etc.) to elementary subjects (math, science, art)
Adapt and implement CT teaching-learning strategies using digital/analog tools to real classroom contexts
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
